results.abstract: Russian Soyuz capsule brings home three astronauts from International Space Station, but malfunctioning control system leaves spacecraft far short of its intended landing site on steppes of Kazakhstan; it takes more than two hours after landing to confirm safety of crew: Capt Kenneth D Bowersox, Dr Donald R Pettit and Nikolai M Budarin (M)

headline.main: 2 Americans and a Russian Return From the International Space Station in a Soyuz Capsule

results.snippet: Three astronauts from the International Space Station, two Americans and a Russian, returned safely to earth in Central Asia today aboard a Russian Soyuz capsule. But a malfunctioning control system left the spacecraft far short of its intended...
results.lead_paragraph: Three astronauts from the International Space Station, two Americans and a Russian, returned safely to earth in Central Asia today aboard a Russian Soyuz capsule. But a malfunctioning control system left the spacecraft far short of its intended landing site. Officials at Russia's mission control center here, north of Moscow, reported that rescue aircraft had been in contact with crew members in the last stages of the descent and after the capsule landed, but it took more than two hours to confirm that the crew was safe.
